adjective.description: Made up of various parts or elements.
Relating to or denoting a classical order of architecture consisting of elements of the Ionic and Corinthian orders.
Relating to or denoting plants of the daisy family (Compositae).

noun.description: A thing made up of several parts or elements.
examples: the English legal system is a composite of legislation and judicial precedent

noun.description: A plant of the daisy family (Compositae).

verb.description: Combine (two or more images) to make a single picture, especially electronically.

origin: Late Middle English (describing a number having more than one digit): via French from Latin compositus, past participle of componere put together.
